$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Central Registration Launches New Express Online Registration Process

a.span: Central Registration Launches New Express Online Registration Process

div.p: To facilitate registration for incoming students during the extended COVID-19 closure, the Central Registration Office has launched a new express online registration process.

a.title: Go to comments for Central Registration Launches New Express Online Registration Process

img.alt: Home Learning Information

div.p: By April 20, 2020, Ken-Ton Schools will transition to a longer-term plan for continued instruction that incorporates new learning. More information can be found here.

a.title: Go to comments for Home Learning Information

img.alt: 'Ken-Ton Cares' Volunteers Work to Address Food Insecurity

a.span: 'Ken-Ton Cares' Volunteers Work to Address Food Insecurity

div.p: A group of people in the Ken-Ton community have come together to form a community-driven rapid response team, called Ken-Ton Cares, to help those struggling with food insecurity amidst the COVID-19 pandemic.

a.title: Go to comments for 'Ken-Ton Cares' Volunteers Work to Address Food Insecurity

img.alt: Schools Closed Due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus)

div.p: Schools will be closed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Click here for the latest updates from the Ken-Ton School District and information/guidance to assist our families. Check back often; information will continue to be added/updated.

a.title: Go to comments for Schools Closed Due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus)

img.alt: Explore Ken-Ton's Career Academies

div.p: Kenmore East and Kenmore West both offer New York State-certified career and technical education programs through the district's four Career Academies: Pre-Engineering, Computer Networking, Information Technology, and Finance

a.title: Go to comments for Explore Ken-Ton's Career Academies

img.alt: 2020-21 Budget Information: Vote May 19, 2020

div.p: Information on the Ken-Ton School District's 2020-21 budget can be found here. Please plan on voting on Tuesday, May 19, 2020.

a.title: Go to comments for 2020-21 Budget Information: Vote May 19, 2020

img.alt: Operation Recognition (Veterans Diploma Information)

div.p: Veterans who left high school without graduating are eligible to earn a New York State high school diploma through Operation Recognition, which recognizes the devotion and sacrifice of all veterans who left school early by presenting them with a high school diploma.

a.title: Go to comments for Operation Recognition (Veterans Diploma Information)

img.alt: Day Camp Provides Fun & Affordable Summer Experience

a.span: Day Camp Provides Fun & Affordable Summer Experience

div.p: For approximately 75 years, the Ken-Ton School District Summer Day Camp Program has provided a fun, educational and low-cost summer-time experience for countless children age 6 to 12.

a.title: Go to comments for Day Camp Provides Fun & Affordable Summer Experience

img.alt: Kindergarten & Universal Pre-Kindergarten Registration

div.p: Registration for Kindergarten and Universal Pre-Kindergarten in the Kenmore-Town of Tonawanda School District for all students who will be attending public and non-public schools will begin in January 2020. More information can be found here.

a.title: Go to comments for Kindergarten & Universal Pre-Kindergarten Registration

img.alt: Up-To-Date Academic Information Available on Portal

a.span: Up-To-Date Academic Information Available on Portal

div.p: Up-to-date academic information for Gr. K-12 parents/guardians is available on the Infinite Campus portal (www.ktufsd.org/portal) and through the Campus Parent App.

a.title: Go to comments for Up-To-Date Academic Information Available on Portal

li.a: View or translate a district notification
Ask a question or share a concern

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Career Academies

div.p: Kenmore East and Kenmore West both offer New York State-certified career and technical education programs through the district's four Career Academies: Pre-Engineering, Computer Networking, Information Technology, and Finance & Enterprise.

a.title: Go to comments for Career Academies

img.alt: Music Programs

div.p: For eight years in a row, Ken-Ton has been among the tiny fraction of the nation's school districts to be designated as a “Best Community for Music Education” by the NAMM Foundation.

a.title: Go to comments for Music Programs

img.alt: International Baccalaureate (IB) Program

div.p: Kenmore East and Kenmore West are two of only four schools in the eight counties of Western New York that offer the prestigious International Baccalaureate (IB) Program.

a.title: Go to comments for International Baccalaureate (IB) Program

img.alt: Art Programs

div.p: The Ken-Ton School District is widely regarded in the Western New York arts community as having one of the region’s leading K-12 art education program with two art career pathways in the Fine Arts and the Media Arts.

a.title: Go to comments for Art Programs

img.alt: Big Picture Program

div.p: The Big Picture Program, located at the former Kenmore Middle School Building, is a non-traditional high school program and the only one of its kind in Western New York.

a.title: Go to comments for Big Picture Program

img.alt: Character Education & Bullying Prevention

div.p: Find information on programs and activities taking place in all schools that promote positive behaviors and a safe and supportive school environment, and what you can do to respond to and report bullying.

a.title: Go to comments for Character Education & Bullying Prevention

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: February 5, 2020 Capital Project Exit Survey Results

a.span: February 5, 2020 Capital Project Exit Survey Results

div.p: On Wednesday, February 5, 2020, voters in the Kenmore-Town of Tonawanda Union Free School District approved the district’s proposed Capital Project by a vote of 1,082 to 328. Voters had the opportunity to take part in an anonymous exit survey. Click here to view the results.

a.title: Go to comments for February 5, 2020 Capital Project Exit Survey Results

img.alt: February 5, 2020 Capital Project Voting Results

div.p: On Wednesday, February 5, 2020, voters in the Kenmore-Town of Tonawanda Union Free School District approved the district’s proposed Capital Project by a vote of 1,082 to 328.

a.title: Go to comments for February 5, 2020 Capital Project Voting Results

img.alt: School & Department Annual Reports

div.p: Schools and departments in the Ken-Ton School District each provide an annual report which will be available for everyone to read. You can find the 2018-19 annual reports here.

a.title: Go to comments for School & Department Annual Reports

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Central Registration Launches New Express Online Process

a.span: Central Registration Launches New Express Online Process

div.p: To facilitate registration for incoming students during the extended COVID-19 closure, the Central Registration Office has launched a new express online registration process.

a.title: Go to comments for Central Registration Launches New Express Online Process

img.alt: High School Students Launch Site for Tutoring, Test Prep

a.span: High School Students Launch Site for Tutoring, Test Prep

div.p: As schools across Western New York remain shuttered due to the COVID-19 pandemic, two seniors at Kenmore West High School have set out to help their classmates continue their academic progress during the closure.

a.title: Go to comments for High School Students Launch Site for Tutoring, Test Prep

img.alt: 'Ken-Ton Cares' Volunteers Work to Address Food Insecurity

a.span: 'Ken-Ton Cares' Volunteers Work to Address Food Insecurity

div.p: A group of people in the Ken-Ton community have come together to form a community-driven rapid response team, called Ken-Ton Cares, to help those struggling with food insecurity amidst the COVID-19 pandemic.

a.title: Go to comments for 'Ken-Ton Cares' Volunteers Work to Address Food Insecurity

img.alt: UPK Program Virtual Classes Begin April 1

a.span: UPK Program Virtual Classes Begin April 1

div.p: The Ken-Ton School District Universal Pre-Kindergarten Program operated by the Ken-Ton YMCA will provide access to virtual classrooms beginning Wednesday, April 1 through Zoom.

a.title: Go to comments for UPK Program Virtual Classes Begin April 1

img.alt: Schools Closed Due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus)

div.p: Schools will be closed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Click here for the latest updates from the Ken-Ton School District and information/guidance to assist our families. Check back often; information will continue to be added/updated.

a.title: Go to comments for Schools Closed Due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus)

img.alt: Hoover Middle Students Create New Recycling Club

a.span: Hoover Middle Students Create New Recycling Club

div.p: Hoover Middle School sixth-grade students Emma Watson, Kiley Rooney, Jillian Hanley and Haleyanna Hodges were inspired by trash they saw littering the landscape and set out to start an Environmental Club at Hoover Middle.

a.title: Go to comments for Hoover Middle Students Create New Recycling Club

img.alt: Holmes Teachers Find Creative Ways to Reward Students

a.span: Holmes Teachers Find Creative Ways to Reward Students

div.p: Teachers at Holmes Elementary have volunteered their time to host fun and unique PBIS ("Positive Behavior Interventions and Support") experiences for students.

a.title: Go to comments for Holmes Teachers Find Creative Ways to Reward Students

img.alt: KW Challenge/Interact Club Brings 'Purple Pinkie' Project to KT

a.span: KW Challenge/Interact Club Brings 'Purple Pinkie' Project to KT

div.p: Thanks to the efforts of students and staff in partnership with the Kenmore Rotary Club, thousands of children will soon receive the polio vaccine as part of an international effort to eradicate the virus.

a.title: Go to comments for KW Challenge/Interact Club Brings 'Purple Pinkie' Project to KT

img.alt: Ken-West Student Transforming Lives Through Yoga

a.span: Ken-West Student Transforming Lives Through Yoga

div.p: Ken-West student Eric Heard, who earned his certification as a yoga instructor in Nairobi and is sharing his passion in Buffalo, will speak at the National Kids Yoga Conference in Washington and was featured by WIVB Ch. 4.

a.title: Go to comments for Ken-West Student Transforming Lives Through Yoga

img.alt: Random Act of Kindness Day Comes to Kenmore Middle

a.span: Random Act of Kindness Day Comes to Kenmore Middle

div.p: Students from adult education classes and the district's Big Picture Program came together for a celebration of kindness and generosity for "Random Act of Kindness" Day the day before Valentine's Day.

a.title: Go to comments for Random Act of Kindness Day Comes to Kenmore Middle

img.alt: Jennifer Gazdovich, Kenmore West High School Teacher

a.span: Jennifer Gazdovich, Kenmore West High School Teacher

div.p: "Mrs. Gazdovich’s love of teaching and true appreciation for working with students is evident by observing her classes and students. Mrs. Gazdovich is always exploring and finding new ways to make the learning of science relevant for her students."

a.title: Go to comments for Jennifer Gazdovich, Kenmore West High School Teacher

img.alt: Sue Goulette, Kenmore West High School Teacher Aide

a.span: Sue Goulette, Kenmore West High School Teacher Aide

div.p: "Mrs. Goulette has worked in the Ken-Ton School District for 29 years; 11 of those years at Kenmore West. Mrs. Goulette is an integral part of the building and its operations."

a.title: Go to comments for Sue Goulette, Kenmore West High School Teacher Aide

img.alt: Emily Forney, Kenmore West High School Student

a.span: Emily Forney, Kenmore West High School Student

div.p: "Emily wants to help students find tools to be successful in life and wants students with disabilities to know to never give up on themselves."

a.title: Go to comments for Emily Forney, Kenmore West High School Student

img.alt: Cheryl Haefner, Hoover Elementary School Support Staff

a.span: Cheryl Haefner, Hoover Elementary School Support Staff

div.p: "She is known to go above and beyond when it comes to helping students and families. She knows that every child needs something different to be successful and she won’t stop until she finds what it is."

a.title: Go to comments for Cheryl Haefner, Hoover Elementary School Support Staff

img.alt: Susan Sperrazza, Hoover Elementary School Social Worker

a.span: Susan Sperrazza, Hoover Elementary School Social Worker

div.p: "She is a kind, generous, helpful person who teaches these skills to the Hoover Hoots and others by example."

a.title: Go to comments for Susan Sperrazza, Hoover Elementary School Social Worker

img.alt: Olivia Boryszak, Hoover Elementary School Teacher

a.span: Olivia Boryszak, Hoover Elementary School Teacher

div.p: "Above Olivia's wonderful attributes as a student, are her attributes as a person. Olivia is one of the most reliable and kind students in Hoover Elementary School."

a.title: Go to comments for Olivia Boryszak, Hoover Elementary School Teacher

img.alt: Susan Hirsch, Edison Elementary School Teacher

a.span: Susan Hirsch, Edison Elementary School Teacher

div.p: Susan Hirsch, Edison Elementary School first-grade teacher, recently earned her National Board Certification, which is considered to be the gold standard in teaching.

a.title: Go to comments for Susan Hirsch, Edison Elementary School Teacher

img.alt: Pierce Moline, Big Picture Program 101 Student

a.span: Pierce Moline, Big Picture Program 101 Student

div.p: He has put great effort into his work this year. His exhibition last month was referred to by his Advisor as, "One of the best exhibitions I have ever seen!"

a.title: Go to comments for Pierce Moline, Big Picture Program 101 Student

img.alt: Kari Piazza, Big Picture Program Senior Clerk Typist

a.span: Kari Piazza, Big Picture Program Senior Clerk Typist

div.p: "She is excellent with the students and we are lucky to have her working with use every day!"

a.title: Go to comments for Kari Piazza, Big Picture Program Senior Clerk Typist

img.alt: Stacey Pritchard, Big Picture Program 401 Advisor

a.span: Stacey Pritchard, Big Picture Program 401 Advisor

div.p: "Stacey has worked tirelessly to provide the support her students need to be successful in school!"

a.title: Go to comments for Stacey Pritchard, Big Picture Program 401 Advisor
